docs.abstract: Readers comment on my column about the perils of toxic stress and the importance of early-childhood interventions.
docs.snippet: Readers comment on my column about the perils of toxic stress and the importance of early-childhood interventions.

docs.lead_paragraph: My Sunday column looks at new evidence of the importance of early childhood and pregnancy on life outcomes. I've been increasingly impressed by the research that suggests that biological mechanisms -- such as the way cortisol floods a small child under stress, disrupting brain development -- appear to lay the groundwork for social disadvantage later. But I was looking for a peg to write about this, and then the American Academy of Pediatrics provided it by issuing a landmark policy statement endorsing this new science of toxic stress.
docs.abstract: Readers comment on my column about the perils of toxic stress and the importance of early-childhood interventions.
docs.snippet: Readers comment on my column about the perils of toxic stress and the importance of early-childhood interventions.

headline.main: NBC Entertainment Head Weighs In on 'Community,' '30 Rock' and 'House'

docs.abstract: Robert Greenblatt told reporters about his thinking as he faces hard choices on what shows to extend on the network. The fall, he said, was "worse than I hoped for, but about what I expected."
docs.snippet: Robert Greenblatt told reporters about his thinking as he faces hard choices on what shows to extend on the network. The fall, he said, was "worse than I hoped for, but about what I expected."

docs.lead_paragraph: PASADENA, Calif. - Robert Greenblatt, who runs entertainment for NBC, acknowledged here that the fall had been brutally difficult for his network's prime time schedule, "worse than I hoped for, but about what I expected."

headline.main: NBC Entertainment Head Weighs In on 'Community,' '30 Rock' and 'House'

docs.lead_paragraph: Effects on students’ lives beyond academics, in areas as varied as teenage-pregnancy and adult earnings, are cited.

headline.main: Big Study Links Good Teachers to Lasting Gain
headline.print_headline: Big Study Links Good Teachers To Lasting Gain

docs.abstract: New study finds that students who had elementary- and middle-school teachers who helped raise their standardized-test scores seem to have a wide-ranging, lasting positive effect on those students’ lives beyond academics, including lower teenage-pregnancy rates and greater college matriculation and adult earnings; study examines a larger number of students over a longer period of time with more in-depth data than many earlier studies, allowing for a deeper look at how much the quality of individual teachers matters over the long term.
docs.snippet: Effects on students’ lives beyond academics, in areas as varied as teenage-pregnancy and adult earnings, are cited.

docs.lead_paragraph: TANEY--Amie Robertson Hollingsworth, born Westchester, PA, September 27, 1921, passed peacefully January 3, 2012, Darien, CT. Beloved wife of J. Charles Taney, II (deceased). Survived by eight children, eleven grandchildren, eight great-grandchildren with two more due this year. University of Pennsylvania class of 1943; Masters in Education, Sarah Lawrence Bank Street College (1972). Guidance counselor at St. Barnabas (Bronx, NY) and Our Lady of Victory (Dobbs Ferry, NY), followed by work as college guidance consultant. Volunteered in college guidance at Truman High School and Salesian Prep. Also long-time volunteer at pregnancy care center New Rochelle. Founded and attended a Prayer Group in Westport, CT that began in the mid-1950's and still meets today. Enthusiastic student of Spanish language classes, Iona College. Avid traveler. Proud member of Kappa Kappa Gamma. Played for the first women's lacrosse team at University of Pennsylvania as well as field hockey. Played hardball, not softball, and had a terrific batting average. Visiting will be on Friday from 2-4 and 7-9pm at the George T. Davis Funeral Home, 14 le Count Place, New Rochelle, NY. (914) 632 0324 with an 11:00am funeral mass on Saturday at the College of New Rochelle's Holy Family Chapel with interment to follow in the Spring Grove Cemetery, Darien, Ct. www.georgetdavis.com
